result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn T Wiskerchen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 9 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: revocation

superMiscConds.notes: **AMENDED 4-6-2016:  Adding restitution.  It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 25% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Statutory court costs assessed.  To be paid during period of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
It is a condition of extended supervision that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Defendant is to take medications as prescribed.
No contact with the victim ND or her family.
No contact with Nicholas Tobias.
No contact with drug dealers or users.  
Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.
Alcohol/drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. Random UA's at discretion of agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ORD that the motion is granted,  Plaintiff-respondent, State of Wisconsin's response brief shall be served and filed on or before July 2, 2018.
ORD that the motion is granted
Motion for Enlargement of time to file opening brief

ORD that the petition for review is granted and that pursuant to Wis. Stat (Rule) 809.62(6), the defendant- appellant-petitioner may not raise or argue issues not set forth in the petition for review unless otherwise ordered by the court.

FORD that pursuant to Wis. Stat 809.62(6) and 809.63, within 30 days after the date of this order the defendant-appellant-petitioner must file a brief in this court; that within 20 days of filing the plaintiff-respondent, State of Wisconsin, must file either a brief or a statement that no brief will be filed; and that if a brief is filed by the plaintiff-respondent, within 10 days of filing the defendant-appellant -petitioner must file either a reply brief or a statement that no reply brief will be filed

FORD that in any brief filed in this court the parties shall not incorporate by reference any portion of their court of appeal' brief or petition for review; instead, any material in these documents upon which there is reliance should be restated in the brief filed in this court.

FORD that the first brief filed in this court must contain, as part of the appendix, a copy of the decision of the court of appeals in this case

FORD that within 30 days after the date of this order, each party must provide the clerk of this court with 10 copies of the brief previously filed on behalf of that party in the COA

FORD that the allowance of costs, if any, in connection with the granting of the petition will abide the decision of this court on review.
Copy of Notice of Entry of Appearance
Atty Jeremy Newman

Defendant Shawn T Wiskerchen in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Defendant Shawn T Wiskerchen in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.  TRANSCRIPT FILED: 1-20-2016/lkh.
this court will not be here next week but we are working with the DCA to get a reserve Judge. The State is prepared to proceed as is defense. No discovery issues. The State is making a concession not to use any recorded statement of defendant either on direct or rebuttal. There will be no mention of the deft being in custody. No 904.04 evidence will be used by the State. No Daubert issues and all witnesses are available for both parties. No crime lab issues. Parties anticipate length of trial to be 2 1/2 - 3 days. 1 alternate, 5 strikes. The Court will read the following preliminary instructions; 50, 103, 148, 55, 58, 300, 140, 101.

BTC: JT remains. Ludwig hearing just prior to voir dire.
